bugs.title: perl-Gtk2: incorrect memory management in Gtk2::Gdk::Display::list_devices

bugzilla.short_desc: perl-Gtk2: incorrect memory management in Gtk2::Gdk::Display::list_devices

long_desc.thetext:
Gtk2 1.2495 fixes an incorrect memory management issue in Gtk2::Gdk::Display::list_devices [1], which can potentially lead to arbitrary code execution.

[1]: https://www.mail-archive.com/gtk-perl-list@gnome.org/msg07790.html

Created perl-Gtk2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1188220]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1188221]
perl-Gtk2-1.2495-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
perl-Gtk2-1.2495-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
perl-Gtk2-1.2495-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
perl-Gtk2-1.2495-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.
